document_data.name: Salabar Street
document_data.mainbody: '''Salabar Street''' was a hard-packed dirt and [[gravel]] road
document_data.Geography: This street ran due southwest off of the [[Court of the White Bull]], intersected [[River Street]], and then curved southeast until terminating on [[Buckle Street]]. At the midpoint of Salabar Street, before it intersected with River Street, it acted as the western terminus of [[Sorn Street]] and the eastern terminus of [[River Square]].

Notable Locations.Felzoun's Folly: a tavern that stood on the western corner of where River Square opened onto Salabar Street.<ref>
